Title: Audio Log 1
Text:
This is my fifth day in the Black Alley. People here are always on edge like they're afraid of something. No one says a word about it, of course.

The Black Alley is an oddity to the Ragunnesi. Youngsters these days don't even know it exists, while the old consider it a forbidden territory. Imagine the uproar it would cause in Ragunna if I wrote about its secrets and published them!

I met a nice fellowâ€”everyone calls him the Runner, although I'm not sure who's pulling his strings. Thanks to his help, I got access to the Black Alley and its many mysteries.

The first three days of my investigation came up empty. But I did get to know a young man named Brandon over a game of pool. Seems like he's spent his fair share of time here. To be honest, he's damn good at the game, a worthy opponent, as long as he isn't cheating. Last time we played, the coat I had hanging nearby suddenly started burning. Luckily, I put it out in time, but by the time I came back, he had "scored" three points while I was gone.

Brandon is really tight-lipped about the Black Alley and always seems preoccupied with something. Still, I believe he could be the breakthrough I need in my investigation. He's not as stubborn as the old timers, nor as much of a pain to talk to as those masks. I still can't figure out where they came from. Maybe I'll figure it out someday.

Speaking of which, I haven't seen Brandon for two days. Maybe he went to help the starving old folks. As I learned during my investigation, the people here scrape by with odd jobs, barely managing to get enough food. Brandon is always sharing his rations with them.

Wherever he's gone, he'll be back for more pool. All I need to do is wait for him.
